questions.question: Why, despite his worries, does Nick leave Gatsby the day after Myrtle's death?

choices.answer: He is too rational to believe in premonitions
He "disapproves of Gatsby from beginning to end"
Jordan asks Nick to stay away
Nick has to go to work

questions.question: How did Gatsby lie to Daisy when they first met?

choices.answer: Gatsby never told her he was married
Gatsby led her to believe they were of the same social class
Gatsby pretended not to be interested in her
Gatsby exaggerated his role in the war

questions.question: What surprising piece of information does Gatsby reveal to Nick?

choices.answer: Gatsby had originally planned to "love Daisy and leave her"
Gatsby never loved Daisy
Gatsby always knew he would lose Daisy
Gatsby plans to kill Daisy if she won't leave Tom

questions.question: Why does George Wilson believe Myrtle was murdered?

choices.answer: Wilson recognized the "death car" as Gatsby's
Wilson recognizes Gatsby as a mob assassin
Wilson believes Myrtle tried to flag down Gatsby's car
Wilson heard Myrtle scream Tom's name

questions.question: Why does George Wilson believe God is watching him?

choices.answer: He has always been a very religious man
He believes Myrtle's death is a punishment from God
He believes Daisy is an angel
He confuses the eyes of Dr. T.J. Eckleburg with God
He believes Gatsby is Myrtle's lover
Tom convinces him Gatsby is to blame
He traces the "death car" to Gatsby's house
Because Myrtle met Tom at Gatsby's party

questions.question: What are Nick's last words to Gatsby?

choices.answer: "So long, old sport"
"I am, and ever shall be, your friend"
"You’re worth the whole damn bunch put together”
"You deserve better than Daisy"

questions.question: Why does Nick refuse to see Jordan after Myrtle's death?

choices.answer: He doesn't want to be linked to the crash
He sees Jordan as part of Daisy's corrupt world
He is afraid of becoming like Gatsby
He only dated Jordan so Gatsby could get close to Daisy

questions.question: How, in the end, does Nick view Gatsby?

choices.answer: The only true friend he ever had
A victim of the American dream
"The first... and last... of a new breed of American"
A corrupt man with an incorruptible dream
Yes, because the main character dies
Yes; the  things that make Gatsby "great" cause his downfall
No; Gatsby is not a tragic hero
No; Gatsby's death is merely a coincidence
